title.rendered: Tips on How to Brighten Up Your Apartment With Plants

content.rendered:
You just moved into your small studio NYC apartment. There’s not much space, so how do you tackle decorating? Look no further! One awesome way to decorate small apartments is with plants. Bright and colorful, plants are a perfect apartment hack for any room that needs a little pop of color.

Whether you’re a plant lover or just need some decorating pointers, plants are a great option for room decor. If you’re looking for some creative plant decorating ideas, here are a few ways to help brighten up your small apartment with plants!

This may interest you! 8 Easy Ways to Make Your New Apartment Homier

Have a wide, empty floor area? Floor plants are the answer!

So you don’t know what to do with the empty space in a room? Invest in a floor plant! Floor plants are an awesome addition to a room that’s a bit spacious, such as a living room. Plus, floor plants are a much cheaper alternative for filling an empty space as opposed to purchasing another piece of furniture.

Where on the floor does your pot go? Make sure your plant is placed near a window and has enough light. In addition, make sure that your floor plant’s dimensions make sense for the room that it’ll be in. Floor plants are bound to make any room feel a bit homier!

Don’t have a green thumb? Invest in succulents and cacti!

Succulents and cacti are popular flora for those who don’t exactly have a green thumb. These plants have also become a sought-after decor trend. Invest in cute potted succulents or cacti if you want a pop of life on your desk or counter! Whether you’re limited on space or just love a vibrant display, creating a versatile setup with various plants can instantly transform your space. Consider checking out some of the popular potted plants collection which offers an array of choices perfect for brightening any living area. This option provides convenience and allows you to select the ideal indoor plant that suits your taste and maintenance capabilities.

These plants are hearty and well-suited for areas in which other plants wouldn’t thrive. Succulents and cacti need little water and sunlight, so they are a great alternative for those who want a real plant but don’t have the time to take care of one. Succulents and cacti can thrive anywhere, so there is no need to worry about finding the perfect spot for them!

Have an empty wall you don’t know what to do with? Wall hanging plants are the perfect apartment hack!

Have a large, empty wall space in your small apartment that you don’t know what to do with? Make a wall of hanging plants! Wall plants are becoming a popular trend among plant lovers.

Pick your favorite wall plant or herb and put them in a small pot. Use a few wood screws to hold your plants into the wall and there you go!

If you’re someone who has a love for carpentry, you could even build shelves for your wall foliage. A great DIY project!

Related: Why Natural Sunlight Is Apartment Decor & Therapy In One

Don’t have an apartment suited for real plants? Go the artificial route.

If you don’t have the time for real foliage, go artificial! Artificial plants require no extra time and energy, so they’re perfect for anyone who’s on the go. Plus, they’ll last forever!

Add a pop of color to any room with an artificial plant of your choice. Fake plants are also a great option for people who want a plant aesthetic but have a small apartment that doesn’t offer enough natural light.

Check out stores such as Home Goods and TJ Maxx for a variety of plant options!

Need some more Roomi in your life? Have your pick from Roomi’s endless recommendations crafted to your needs. Doesn’t matter if you’re looking for a room to call home, a couch to call your bed or a mate to share these with! Download the app here — and get surfin’
